dct_alternative_sm: Der Gabūn und Seine Zuflüsse Nach den Aufnahmen der Französichen Schiffslieutenants Floix 1849, Braouezec, Dumesnil & Serval 1858 bis 1861
dct_description_sm: Relief shown by hachures and soundings.
Prime meridian: Paris (at top); Greenwich (at bottom).
Bar scales on maps given in "Deutsche Meilen" and "Englische Statute Miles."
Includes key at lower left (indicating routes); legend at lower right.

6 inset maps: 1. Bowdich (North-Western Africa) 1821 -- 2. Cooley (Inner Africa laid open) 1852 -- 3. Kiepert (Neuer Hand-Atlas) 1861 -- 4. Du Chaillu (Explorations & adventures) 1861 -- 5. Barth Berliner Zeitschrift, Nov. 1861 -- 6. Petermann 1862
Appears in Petermann's Geographische Mittheilungen, Gotha: Justus Perthes, 1862.
dct_creator_sm: Barth, Heinrich, 1821-1865. Reisen und Entdeckungen in Nord- und Central-Afrika in den Jahren 1849 bis 1855. Selections
dct_rights_sm: Image from the Caroline Batchelor Map Collection courtesy Stanford University Libraries. This item is in the public domain. There are no restrictions on use. If you have questions, please contact the David Rumsey Map Center at rumseymapcenter@stanford.edu.
